properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 1:14AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
At 113 AM EST...a strong thunderstorm was over Turtle Cove, or 9
miles northeast of Jackson...moving northeast at 30 mph.

HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind...frequent cloud to ground lightning
and heavy rain.

IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light...unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary
street flooding especially in poor drainage areas.

Some locations in the path of this storm include
Monticello, Rutledge, Newborn, Mansfield, Shady Dale, Stewart, Turtle
Cove, Worthville, Godfrey, Central Georgia Experiment Stn, Calvin,
Farrar, Eudora and North Alcovy.
properties.instruction:
People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear
thunder...you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists
should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to
hydroplaning.

LAT...LON 3325 8385 3341 8395 3362 8359 3338 8344
TIME...MOT...LOC 0613Z 241DEG 24KT 3337 8383

WIND...40MPH

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR NORTHEASTERN BUTTS...SOUTHWESTERN MORGAN...NORTHWESTERN PUTNAM...JASPER AND SOUTHEASTERN NEWTON COUNTIES UNTIL 200 AM EST
